intro: Jatropha paganuccii, commonly known as the Paganuccii physic nut, is a shrub native to the arid regions of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, toxic berries that contain seeds used for oil extraction. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in disturbed or degraded habitats.
